guide.abstract: The complete roadmap for the Gentoo Documentation Project

section.title: GDP Roadmap for Gentoo Linux 1.4 final

body.note: Please note that this roadmap is dynamic. While the GDP team will try to follow it as much as possible, it is understandable that it could grow or shrink according to changing release schedules and outstanding circumstances.

tr.ti: All GDP/ Gentoo documentation will be licensed under an open license, yet to be decided upon.

The GDP will grow to include developers to actively cover all subprojects within the GDP project. The management structure will grow to incorporate the leaders of all subprojects in the decision making process.

All official documentation, or at the very least, all core documentation, will be translated into all major international languages, defined by, but not limited to French, German, Japanese, Russian, and Dutch.
Portage will be fully documented. This full documentation will include API documentation, as well as user documentation.
Along with maintenance, the kernel guide will grow to include instructions on building kernels under Gentoo Linux.
The GDP team will integrate with other Gentoo projects, such as the Gentoo Hardened project, in order to promote and continue complete Gentoo Linux documentation.
Completion of GDP documentation submission engine
The GDP documentation submission system will be finished.
To improve the amount of online quality documentation we need to put the Gentoo specific manual pages online.
